title: Where Is There Idolatry in Modern Culture?

create a theme throughout a chapter

title: You Can Understand the Old Testament (2 Simple Ideas Help!)
description:
This session is from the BibleProject Classroom class Introduction to the Hebrew Bible taught by Dr. Tim Mackie. The entire class is available for free on the BibleProject app at https://classroom-beta.bibleproject.com/introduction-to-the-hebrew-bible.

How can we read the Old Testament and understand the meaning its ancient authors intended? 

These two simple ideas are at the core of the process.
1. The Old Testament is an ancient text.
2.  A text is intentional literary communication. 

We interpret every text we read through the lens of our mental storehouse, or the "encyclopedia" of words, ideas, images, and stories stowed in our memories. But the biblical authors have their own encyclopedias from which they produce texts. So if we want to understand the authors' intended meaning, we will adapt our ‚Äúencyclopedia of reception‚Äù by learning about the authors' ‚Äúencyclopedia of production.‚Äù Dive into this class session with Dr. Tim Mackie and start developing tools for encountering the Old Testament on its own terms.

title: What the Biblical Authors Meant by the Word "Earth"
description:
This session is from the BibleProject Classroom class Heaven and Earth, taught by Dr. Tim Mackie. The entire class is available for free on the BibleProject app at http://classroom-beta.bibleproject.com/heaven-and-earth.

What did the biblical authors intend to communicate when they used the word "earth?" Genesis 1 is an ancient cosmology that uses specific words and images to describe the ordered world as understood by ancient people. When we study this chapter, we can discover how the writers of the Bible understood the structure of the world and its origins 

In Hebrew, the word for "earth" ('erets) typically means land rather than a globe or sphere floating in space. The raqia' is the solid dome above the land that holds back the waters above, and the creation of the raqia' creates a place where life can flourish. Dive into Genesis 1 and explore how these Hebrew words can help us see the important theological claim being made through this cosmology picture.

description: It‚Äôs not explicitly stated, but the theme of the firstborn first appears in the opening narratives of the Hebrew Bible. In Genesis 3, a snake, who is some kind of spiritual being, tricks the humans despite their authority as God‚Äôs image bearers. This story is echoed in other accounts of sibling rivalry that continue throughout the Hebrew Bible. Join Tim and Jon as they discuss the land rulers and sky rulers and the theme of the firstborn in Genesis 1-3.

title: God's Response to Human Power Structures ‚Ä¢ Firstborn Ep. 1
description: In ancient Near Eastern societies, firstborn sons were prized above all other children and inherited special privileges and authority simply because of their birth order. In this episode, Tim and Jon start a new theme study covering the theme of the firstborn. Spoiler alert: The God of the Bible opposes lots of human ideas about power, and the privilege of the firstborn is no exception. Again and again, we‚Äôll see Yahweh picking younger siblings and people we wouldn‚Äôt expect to be his chosen representatives.

In this episode, you'll learn ...

title: How God Begins to Describe Himself in the Bible
description:
Compassion is a deeply emotional word used to convey the strong bond between a parent and their child. In this video, we look at this rich Hebrew word, the first one God uses to describe himself in Exodus 34:6-7. God is portrayed as a compassionate parent throughout Scripture‚Äîboth as a mother and a father, and his compassion is embodied in the person of Jesus.

#Compassion #BibleProject #BibleVideo

title: Season 7 Preview: Compassion
description:
Compassion is a key attribute of God, but the Hebrew word used for compassion in the Bible‚Äîrakhum‚Äîis actually related to the Hebrew word for a mother‚Äôs womb. We look at this word and the powerful biblical images of God as a nurturing mother-figure in one of our upcoming videos for Season 7.

#BibleProject #Compassion #BibleVideo

title: Season 7 Preview: Visual Commentary - Genesis 1
description:
The opening pages of the Bible set up key themes and patterns that inform the entire story of the Bible. In one of our upcoming videos for Season 7, we take a closer look at the literary design of Genesis 1. It‚Äôs the first video in a new series that we‚Äôre calling Visual Commentary.

#Genesis #BibleProject #BibleVideo

title: The Mind of a Researcher: Process Series
description:
In our latest video from our Process series, we hear from Tim as he talks about devoting your life to research. It‚Äôs not for everyone, and it takes a certain type of person to obsess over details and keep asking questions. But lucky for us, Tim loves this work and continues to be fascinated by the story of the Bible. 

#BibleProject #BibleVideo #Process

title: The Habit of Open-Mindedness: Process Series
description:
In our latest video from our Process series, we talk about how important it is to set aside our assumptions about the world when reading the Bible and instead work to understand what the biblical authors were actually trying to communicate. When we cultivate a habit of open-mindedness when studying the Scriptures, there is endless discovery over a lifetime of reading available to all of us.

#BibleProject #BibleVideo #Process

title: Biblical Scholarship: Process Series
description:
A lot of research goes into each of our videos, and in the latest video from our Process series, Tim shares one of the most fascinating aspects of the research‚îÄthe history of biblical scholarship. For thousands of years, scholars and readers from all over the world have been trying to understand the Bible, and now we get to benefit from generations of illuminating thought and conversation as we too try to make sense of the biblical story. Learn more about this important step in our process from our latest Process video, Biblical Scholarship.

#BibleProject #BibleVideos #Process

title: Choosing Our Video Topics: Process Series
description:
Take a look behind the scenes of BibleProject with our new Process series. Hear from Tim, Jon, and the rest of the team as they discuss everything that goes into the making of our animated videos. In this video, Tim talks about how we choose our video topics.

#BibleProject #BibleVideos #Process

Biblical authors often referenced and quoted their favorite parts of Scripture, and the list of God's character traits found in Exodus 34:6-7 is the most repeated and re-quoted text in the Bible. In this video, we'll explore this foundational description of God's attributes that illustrates what God values and why he acts the way he does.

title: How to Read the Bible: Apocalyptic Literature
description:
It‚Äôs the apocalypse! But what exactly does that mean? The Bible is filled with dreams and visions about human history coming to a climax, and they‚Äôre usually packed with intense imagery and strange symbols. In this video, we‚Äôll explore the meaning of the word ‚Äúapocalypse‚Äù in the Bible, and we‚Äôll learn some basic steps for reading this literature with more wisdom and insight.

title: New Testament Letters: Literary Context
description:
In the New Testament, there are 21 letters written by early Christian leaders to communities of Jesus' followers in the ancient Roman world. These letters are rich with theology and guidance for what it means to be a community of Jesus followers, but they can also be dense and hard to understand. In this video we‚Äôll explore the literary style of ancient letter writing and show you how to trace the core ideas from a letter‚Äôs beginning all the way to its end. 

#BibleProject #BibleVideo #Epistles

title: Why Water Matters in the Bible
description:
In the beginning of the Bible, God transforms a desolate wilderness into a garden through a stream that waters the ground and brings life wherever it goes. This image gets developed throughout the biblical story as wells, cisterns, rain, and rivers all become images of God‚Äôs creative power. In this video, we‚Äôll explore the ‚Äúwater of life‚Äù theme through the biblical story and see how it leads to Jesus, who presents himself as the one bringing living water to a world that is desperately thirsty. 

#BibleProject #WaterofLife #BibleVideo

title: Is the Tree of Life Practical? - BibleProject Podcast
description:
Did you know we have a podcast? Find out more at: tbp.xyz/bibleprojectpodcast
Watch our video on the Tree of Life here: tbp.xyz/tree

We are concluding our Tree of Life series with a question and response episode. In this episode, Tim and Jon respond to audience questions on the theme of the Tree of Life in the Bible. Thank you to everyone that submitted questions!

#TreeofLife #BibleProject #Podcast

title: New Testament Letters: Historical Context
description:
In the New Testament, there are 21 letters or epistles written by early Christian leaders to communities of Jesus' followers in the ancient Roman world. A wise reading of these letters involves learning about their historical context. Who were the letters written to, where did the recipients live, and what prompted sending the letter? In this video, we explore the different layers of historical context with these letters, so that we can better understand the wisdom they still have to offer. 

#BibleProject #Epistle #NewTestament

title: We Studied the Tree of Life in the Bible (Here‚Äôs What We Found)
description:
In the opening pages of the Bible, God gives humanity a gift that they quickly forfeit‚Äîeternal life that comes by eating from the tree of life. In this video, we explore the meaning of this powerful image and how sacred trees play a key role throughout the story of the Bible. It all leads up to Jesus himself, who died upon a tree so that he could become a new tree of life for all humanity. 

#BibleProject #TreeofLife #Eden

title: Why Jesus Told Parables (and How You Can Understand Them)
description:
Jesus of Nazareth was a master storyteller, and many of his most well-known teachings were told as parables. But these stories were designed to do much more than simply "teach." Jesus said the parables were designed to both reveal and conceal his message about the arrival of God's Kingdom. In this video, we explore the main themes in Jesus' parables and ask why he used them as the primary vehicle for his message.

#BibleProject #Parables #Jesus

title: SABBATH: Learn Why the Number 7 Is Used So Much in the Bible
description:
On page one of the Bible, God orders a beautiful world out of chaotic darkness within a sequence of six days. And on the seventh day, God rests. This introduces the major biblical theme of patterns of seven that conclude with God and humans resting together as partners. In this video, we explore the theme of seventh day rest and the biblical concept of Sabbath. We also look at why Jesus adopted this idea as a major part of his own mission to bring God's Kingdom to earth.

Explore Sabbath page here: https://tbp.xyz/exploresabbath
Sabbath podcast series here: https://tbp.xyz/sabbathpodcast 

#BibleProject #Sabbath #7thDayRest

title: Join The Bible Project ‚Ä¢ 2019 Studio Update
description:
We have a lot to celebrate. We‚Äôre so thankful for all of your enthusiasm and support that has helped a small idea grow into what it is today. We‚Äôre continuing to expand our existing resources as well as explore new platforms and ways for people to experience the Bible. Find out how to support BibleProject and the exciting things we have in store for 2020.

https://tbp.xyz/join2019

#BibleProject #Join

title: Witness
description:
In the Bible, the word ‚Äúwitness‚Äù is used to describe both a person and an action‚Äîsomeone who sees something and then talks about what they‚Äôve seen. Similar to today, this word is used in both legal settings and to describe an experience with God. But what‚Äôs most interesting about the word witness is how it illuminates the story of Scripture, especially the role of the people of God. In this video, we explore how this word contributes to the overarching story of the Bible.

#BibleProject #Witness #BibleVideo

title: The Gospel
description:
The New Testament contains four ancient biographies of Jesus of Nazareth, and altogether they are called ‚Äúthe Gospel.‚Äù Each one tells the story as an announcement of good news that the crucified and risen Jesus is the true ruler of the nations. In this video, we explore why these accounts were written and how you can read them with greater insight.

#BibleProject #Gospel #BibleVideo

title: This Lie Can Keep You From Living Generously
description:
In the story of the Bible, God is depicted as a generous host who provides for the needs of his guests. However, humans live from a mindset of scarcity and hoard God‚Äôs many gifts. In this video on Generosity, we explore God‚Äôs plan for overcoming our selfishness by giving the ultimate gift of himself in the person of Jesus.

#BibleProject #BibleVideo #Generosity

title: Gospel
description:
‚ÄúGospel‚Äù is one of the most common words in a Christian‚Äôs vocabulary. But what does it mean in the original languages of the Bible? In this video, we‚Äôll discover that ‚Äúgospel‚Äù is a royal announcement about Jesus, who is the crucified and risen King of the world who overcame death with his love.

0:00 What the word gospel means in the Bible
0:41 The gospel in the Old Testament
1:27 Jesus' gospel of God's kingdom
2:51 Jesus' followers spread the gospel

#BibleProject #gospel #wordstudy #gospelmessage #biblevideo #biblevideos

title: We Studied the Temple in the Bible (Here‚Äôs What We Found)
description:
In this video, we explore how Israel‚Äôs temple in the Bible is described as the place where God‚Äôs space and humanity‚Äôs space are one. In fact, the whole biblical drama can be told as a story about God‚Äôs temple. In the opening pages of Genesis, God creates a cosmic temple, and in the person of Jesus, God takes up personal residence in his temple-world. By the end of the biblical story, all of creation has become God‚Äôs sacred temple. 

#Temple #BibleProject #BibleVideo

title: Season 6 Preview: 7th Day Rest
description:
The terms "Sabbath" and "7th Day Rest" have experienced renewed interest in recent years. What is the sabbath, and what significance does this ancient ritual have for followers of Jesus today? In Season 6, we‚Äôll explore this theme in the Bible and what it means for us to rest in God.

#TheBibleProject #Sabbath #7thDayRest

title: Season 6 Preview: Tree of Life
description:
Season 6 will feature a video with an exciting new perspective‚Äîyours. Because the choice first given to humanity is a choice each of us makes every day, we decided to place you at the forefront of the action by making the video in the first-person perspective. Stay tuned for Tree of Life.

#TheBibleProject #TreeofLife #BibleVideo

title: Season 6 Preview: Temple
description:
Can you believe it? Season 6 of The Bible Project starts next week! Stay tuned for our first video exploring the theme of the temple in the Bible. What was the point of the temple? Why did God need a physical space to meet with people? And do we still need a temple today? We‚Äôll explore all these fascinating questions as we launch Season 6 next week. We can‚Äôt wait!

#TheBibleProject #Temple #BibleVideo

title: The Books of Solomon
description:
The wisest king of Israel, King Solomon, is associated with three books of the Bible: Proverbs, Ecclesiastes, and the Song of Songs. Each book offers a unique perspective on how humans can rule with wisdom and the fear of the Lord. In this video, we briefly explore how the message of each book fits into the overall story of the Bible.

#Solomon #Proverbs #Wisdom

title: The New Humanity ‚Ä¢ The New Kind of Existence We're Invited To (Spiritual Beings Series Episode 7)
description:
In the opening pages of the Bible, God appoints humans to rule the world on his behalf. But when they rebel, the biblical story leads us on a search for a new humanity that will be God‚Äôs faithful partners, forever. This is the plot conflict of the biblical story that leads to Jesus, and we explore it in this final video of our Spiritual Being series.

#NewHumanity #BibleProject #BibleVideo

title: The Satan and Demons Question and Response - BibleProject
description:
The topic of The Satan and Demons explores some of the strangest passages in the entire Bible. We gathered some of your questions after our video released and respond to them in a question and response video. Thank you for engaging with our content!

Link to our podcast: http://bit.ly/2Wl4LdG
Link to notes: https://bit.ly/2VKtfI1
The Satan and Demons video: http://bit.ly/2KrOAE2

Questions

1. (1:14) Why did God allow The Satan to live in the Garden of Eden, even if it was in rebellion against Him?

2. (5:22) What are the seraphim? Why do you call seraphim "snakes" instead of "burning ones?"

3. (13:06) Wasn't The Satan named Lucifer? Where did the name "Lucifer" come from?

4. (19:22) Why do you say "The Satan" instead of just "Satan?" Why did translators leave out the "The" when translating the Bible?

5. (24:42) When the world was created, God said it was "good." Why did you say The Satan brings creation back into chaos and death in the video?

6. (29:10) How can the sons of God have sexual relations with human women if they are spiritual beings? Do spiritual beings have reproductive organs?

7. (40:01) What are the Nephilim and where did they come from?

8. (42:47) How do humans participate in the evil we see in the world?

9. (44:47) Why did you end the video with Jesus being overtaken by evil?


#Satan #Demons #BibleProject

title: The Satan and Demons ‚Ä¢ Understand Evil Spiritual Beings in the Bible (Spiritual Beings Series Ep 4)
description:
The storyline of the Bible presents a populated spiritual world, full of creatures who are in rebellion against their Creator, just like humans. For lots of fascinating reasons, our modern conceptions of the Satan and demons are based on serious misunderstandings of the Bible. So let‚Äôs go back to the book of Genesis and start over as we learn about the powers of spiritual evil in the story of the Bible.

Link to The Satan and Demons video notes: http://bit.ly/30MK2O1
Link to The Satan and Demons Question and Response video: https://bddy.me/2KnZcUn

Special thanks to Dr. Michael S. Heiser, author of ‚ÄúThe Unseen Realm,‚Äù for script consulting on this series.

00:00 Introduction
00:10 The Bible's first portrait of evil
01:11 The snake in the Garden of Eden
02:11 How biblical authors talk about the Satan
03:11 The rebellion of demons
04:47 How demons work evil into the world
05:11 How Jesus viewed pain and suffering

#BibleProject #Satan #Demons #Angels #DivineCouncil

title: Who the Angel of the Lord Is (and What the Angel Does) ‚Ä¢ Spiritual Beings Ep. 5
description:
The Angel of the Lord is one of the most fascinating spiritual beings in the Hebrew Scriptures. Every time this figure appears, he‚Äôs depicted as if he is God, but also an angel sent by God. In this video, we explore this paradoxical character and discover how he prepares us for the grand claims that will be made about Jesus in the New Testament.

Special thanks to Dr. Michael S. Heiser, author of ‚ÄúThe Unseen Realm,‚Äù for script consulting on this series.

#Angels #AngeloftheLord #BibleVideo #Demons #DivineCouncil

title: Biblical Law
description:
Have you ever wondered why there are so many ancient biblical laws in the first books of the Bible? What are modern readers supposed to do with them, and why are some of them so odd? In this video, we explore why the laws were given to ancient Israel and how they fit into the overall storyline of the Bible.

#Law #BibleProject #BibleVideo

title: Angels and Cherubim ‚Ä¢ Who They Are and What They Do (Spiritual Beings Series Episode 4)
description:
Did you know that angels in the Bible don‚Äôt have wings? Or that cherubim are not cute, chubby babies? In this video, we explore the biblical portrayals of angels and cherubim to understand just who they are and what role they play in the story of the Bible.

Special thanks to Dr. Michael S. Heiser, author of ‚ÄúThe Unseen Realm,‚Äù for script consulting on this series.

#BibleProject #Angels #SpiritualBeings #Demons #DivineCouncil

title: Learn About the Hidden Forces Guiding the World ‚Ä¢ Spiritual Beings (Ep. 3)
description:
What on earth is the divine council? Well, for starters, it‚Äôs not on earth! This biblical phrase describes the concept of spiritual powers that God created to have authority alongside humans... until everyone rebels and creates huge problems that only Jesus can resolve. We dig into all of this and more in episode three of our Spiritual Beings series.

Special thanks to Dr. Michael S. Heiser, author of ‚ÄúThe Unseen Realm,‚Äù for script consulting on this series.

#BibleProject #BibleVideo #DivineCouncil #Angels #Demons

title: Elohim
description:
Did you know that the biblical word for God, Elohim, is actually a title and not a name? And did you know that "Elohim" can refer to other spiritual beings as well as to the creator God? In this video, we explore the biblical terminology for spiritual beings and how this helps us understand what the Bible means when it says that ‚ÄúGod is one.‚Äù

Special thanks to Dr. Michael S. Heiser, author of ‚ÄúThe Unseen Realm,‚Äù for script consulting on this series.

#Elohim #BibleProject #BibleVideo #Angels #Demons #DivineCouncil

title: Who Spiritual Beings Are and What They're Like ‚Ä¢ Spiritual Beings Series (Episode 1)
description:
In the first pages of the Bible, we‚Äôre introduced to God and humans as the main characters. But there‚Äôs also a whole cast of spiritual beings who play an important role throughout the Bible, though they‚Äôre often in the background. In this video, we begin to explore these beings and how they fit into the unified storyline of the Bible.

Special thanks to Dr. Michael S. Heiser, author of ‚ÄúThe Unseen Realm,‚Äù for script consulting on this series.

#SpiritualBeings #BibleProject #BibleVideo #Angels #Demons #DivineCouncil

In the final video in our Acts series, we trace Paul‚Äôs final journey to Jerusalem and then into a Roman prison. But paradoxically, Paul‚Äôs suffering leads him into the heart of the Roman empire where he gets to announce God‚Äôs Kingdom over the nations.

#Acts #Paul #BibleProject

title: How to Read the 15 Prophetic Books in the Bible
description:
The books of the Old Testament prophets are packed with dense poetry and wild imagery. If you‚Äôve tried to read them, odds are you were both intrigued and confused. In this video, we‚Äôll learn how these prophetic books contribute to the storyline of the Bible and why it‚Äôs worth learning how to read them more attentively.

#Prophets #BibleProject #BibleVideo

title: Why Jesus Called Himself the Son of Man
description:
If you thought ‚ÄúChrist‚Äù was Jesus‚Äô last name or the title he gave himself, think again! The title Jesus most often used for himself is the "Son of Man.‚Äù In this video, we‚Äôll explore the meaning of this fascinating phrase and see how it invites us into the larger biblical story.

#SonofMan #BibleProject #Jesus

title: Paul's Missionary Journeys: Acts 13-20
description:
What was it like for the apostle Paul to travel around the Roman Empire announcing the good news about the risen Jesus? What drove him to plant new Jesus communities in city after city, and how did people respond to his message? In our third video on the book of Acts, we‚Äôll explore all of this and more.

#Acts #Paul #BibleProject

title: The Book of Psalms
description:
The book of Psalms is the largest collection of poetry in the Bible. In this video, we‚Äôll explore the design shape and main themes of this marvelous book, which was crafted to be read from beginning to end. The Psalms are an invitation to a literary temple where you can meet with God and hear the entire biblical storyline retold in poetic form.

#Psalms #BibleProject #BibleVideo

#Exile #BibleProject #BibleVideo

title: How God is Both One and Three at the Same Time
description:
The God portrayed in the Bible isn‚Äôt easy to understand, but what if we could better understand what it is that we can‚Äôt understand? In this video, we will explore the complex identity of God displayed in the storyline of the Bible, and (surprise!) it all leads to Jesus.

#God #BibleProject #Trinity

title: Iniquity
description:
Iniquity is a biblical word that very few people use anymore, and even fewer people know what it means! In this video, we‚Äôll explore the significance of this word in ancient Hebrew, and discover a whole new way to think about our selfish decisions and their consequences.

#Iniquity #BibleVideo #BibleProject

title: Metaphor in Biblical Poetry
description:
Understanding how metaphors are used in the Bible is an essential tool for reading biblical poetry. Anytime someone describes one thing to describe another thing, they are using metaphorical thinking whether they realize it or not. Metaphors are everywhere in the Bible and in our everyday speech. In this video, we‚Äôll explore this crucial aspect of biblical language.

#Metaphor #BibleProject #Metaphor

#Acts #Pentecost #BibleProject

description:
Did you know that a third of the Bible is ancient Israelite poetry? Poetry is a rich and artistic form of human communication, but often the most difficult to read. In this video we‚Äôll explore the unique characteristics of biblical poetry, so you can discover its beauty and power for yourself.

#Poetry #BibleProject #BibleVideo

title: Transgression
description:
"Transgression" is one of those Bible words that seems clear until you have to explain it to somebody. In this video, we'll explore the fascinating and sophisticated meaning of this biblical "bad word." Get ready for a sobering reflection on human nature.

#Transgression #BibleVideo #BibleProject

title: Design Patterns in Biblical Narrative
description:
Design patterns are one of the key ways the biblical authors have unified the storyline of the Bible. Individual stories across the Old and New Testaments have been coordinated through repeated words and parallel themes. These patterns highlight core themes of the biblical story and show how it all leads to Jesus.

#Bible #BibleProject #BibleVideo

title: BTS: Exile Series on the BibleProject Podcast
description: In this video, Tim and Jon discuss the inception of The Bible Project podcast and touch on why Exile is such a critical, yet often overlooked, theme in the Bible. You can catch up on all of our podcasts here: thebibleproject.com/podcasts/

title: What Does It Mean to Sin?
description:
The word ‚Äúsin‚Äù is one of the most common bad words in the Bible, but what does it really mean? In this video, we‚Äôll explore the concept of ‚Äúmoral failure‚Äù that underlies this important biblical word. Get ready to discover a profound and realistic portrait of the human condition.

#Sin #BibleVideo #BibleProject

title: Setting in Biblical Narrative
description:
Every story has to take place somewhere, and very often locations have a special meaning or significance evoked by events that already took place there. In this video, we explore how biblical authors use settings in the narrative to meet the reader's expectations or mess with them. Paying attention to locations and time in biblical stories unlocks deeper layers of meaning.

title: Character in Biblical Narrative
description:

#BibleCharacter #BibleProject #BibleVideo

title: Agape - Love
description:
The word ‚Äúlove‚Äù is one of the sloppiest words in our language, as it primarily refers to a feeling that happens to a person. In the New Testament, ‚Äúlove‚Äù or "Agape" refers to a way of treating people that was defined by Jesus himself: seeking the well-being of others regardless of their response.

description:
"Peace" is a very common word in English, that means different things to different people. It's also a very important word in the Bible that refers not only to the absence of conflict but also to the presence of something else. In this video, we'll explore the core meaning of biblical peace, or Shalom, and how it all leads to Jesus.

title: What It Means to Love God With "All Your Soul"
description:
We explore the Hebrew word "nephesh" that often gets translated as "soul." The English word usually refers to a non-material essence of a human that survives after death, but nephesh means something different. It is referring to humans as living, breathing, physical beings, or just to life itself. Prepare to be surprised at the biblical meaning of this fascinating word.

#Soul #BibleProject #Shema

#Justice #BibleProject #BibleVideo

title: Plot in Biblical Narrative
description:
An important part of reading biblical narratives is learning how to understand the nature of "the plot," how stories are arranged into a pattern of conflict and resolution. In this video we'll see how ignoring the sequence of the plot can lead to a distorted interpretation of biblical stories. We'll also explore how grasping the multi-layered nature of the narrative can help you see the unified story that leads to Jesus.

#Bible #BibleProject #BibleVideo

title: The Crucifixion of Jesus: Luke 19-23
description:

In this video, we'll explore the Gospel of Luke 19-23, and how it came about that the innocent Jesus ended up being executed as a revolutionary rebel against Rome. We'll also see how Jesus was not at all surprised because he believed that his death would open up a new future for Israel, and for all humanity.

In this video, we'll explore the ancient Hebrew words for "heart" as well as the different ideas of what our hearts represent. There is no biblical word that captures better the essence of human thought, feeling, and desire than this rich and wonderful word.

#Shema #BibleProject #Heart

title: Book of Revelation Summary: A Complete Animated Overview (Part 1)
description:
In this video, you're going to learn what the Book of Revelation is all about. Join us as we explore John's visions and you'll learn the symbolic imagery and numbers of the book; including the seven seals, seven trumpets, seven bowls, the Lion of Judah, the 144,000, the two witnesses, and more.

00:00 Summary of historical background, context and meaning
02:09 Jesus' message to the seven churches
03:44 John's vision of the throne of God
05:29 The cycle of the seven seals
08:22 The cycle of seven trumpets and the unsealed scroll

John makes it clear that the Book of Revelation is both an "apocalypse" (revelation) and a "prophecy." This type of Jewish literature recounted a prophet's symbolic visions that revealed God's heavenly perspective on history, so that the present could be viewed in light of history's final outcome. It was meant to comfort and/or challenge God's people. 

John says he was exiled on the island of Patmos, where he saw a vision of the risen Jesus standing among seven burning lights. The image, adapted from Zechariah 4, is a symbol of seven churches in Asia Minor. Jesus addressed the specific problems facing each church, and warned them that a "tribulation" was upon the churches that would force them to choose between compromise and faithfulness. In the midst of persecution, Jesus calls the churches to faithfulness.

#BibleProject #biblebookoverviews #prophecy #revelation #endtimes #apocalypse #newtestament #revelations #secondcoming #eschatology #biblevideo #biblevideos #bookofrevelation

title: What is The Bible Project?
description:
What is The Bible Project?

The Bible Project is a non-profit animation studio that produces short-form, fully animated videos to make the biblical story accessible to everyone, everywhere. We create videos, podcasts, and study guides that explore the Bible‚Äôs unified story.

The Bible is a divine-human book that speaks God‚Äôs word to his people. We believe it ultimately points us to Jesus, who has the power to change individuals and whole communities when we let the biblical story speak for itself.

We focus on the Bible's overarching themes and each book‚Äôs literary design and are committed to understanding the Bible in its historical context.
